title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed.
EB: The children nodes should be listed when changing the data source. The expected result is that when the data source is changed, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor and navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source.
Actual result: The new data source does not display any database, table, or column information. The children nodes are not listed.

Close the data set editor and reopen it to see the issue persist.
